Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma has been in hot form in the World Cup this year, with 265 runs in four games under his belt. Having become the most prolific SIX hitter in international cricket, the Indian skipper is one away from being the first Indian to notch 50 ODI sixes in a calendar year.
Shubman Gill bossing over his favourite opponents
Virat Kohli vs Trent Boult and an entertaining modern cricket rivalry at the scenic venue in Dharamsala.
Miscellaneous Highlights: It’s the battle of the unbeatens in World Cup 2023 when hosts India take on table-toppers New Zealand at the scenic HCPA Stadium in Dharamsala on Sunday (October 22).
Both teams have won each of the their four opening games in CWC23.
India vs New Zealand: Numbers Talk - Head-to-head record (ODIs) - India has lost more matches against New Zealand than they've won.
Highest run-scorers - Sachin Tendulkar leads India with 1750 runs, Ross Taylor leads New Zealand with 1385 runs.
Highest wicket-takers - Javagal Srinath leads India with 51 wickets, Tim Southee leads New Zealand with 35 wickets.
Others: Recharge your vocal chords to chant ‘Chak de India’ at every boundary struck and every wicket taken by the Men in Blue, carry extra clothing when the early heat is swapped with the evening chill, and keep a strong BELIEVE in Hitman and Co. to win their first ODI World Cup game against the Kiwis in 20 years.
